item.description:
If you cannot make the Bethel trip this Christmas, meet us by 12:30 p.m. at the Kendall Square Cinema in Cambridge on Christmas Day for a movie matinee, followed by (what else) Chinese food.  Judi will be in the movie theatre lobby at 12:20.  Chang Sho is very good at 1712 MA Ave between Harvard and Porter Sq. (parking lot across the street).

Please confirm your RSVP, whether for movie and dinner, movie alone or dinner alone.  Say this in your comments under RSVP.  Our reservation is for around 4pm.   Movie is Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy.

Events Leaders: Judi W and Andrea N

RSVP: Required by Dec. 21. Snow cancels. 

 Cost: Movie and refreshments and dinner plus $5 charge which can be credited to a full Mosaic membership of $25.  There is street parking at a meter or garage parking. Please plan ahead if you want to go out with the group after the film, and bring CASH.

 Andrea and Judi will be at the theater 30 minutes prior to the show, 12:20. If we head in 15 minutes before it starts, we can get acquainted, be assured of good seats together, get drinks or snacks and check out the previews. 

If you miss the group ahead of time, come find us after.  We will gather in the lobby to discuss the film a bit, allow for restroom breaks and everyone who wants to come to dinner has transportation.  At this time we have a couple of cars and need a couple more volunteers willing to drive to the restaurant.  The restaurant is between Harvard and Porter T stations.

The movie has been chosen below.

 Tinker Tailor Soldier Spy.

Tinker, Tailor, Soldier, Spy is the long-awaited feature film version of John le Carré's classic bestselling thriller. The time is 1973. The Cold War of the mid-20th century continues to threaten international relations. Britain's Secret Intelligence Service (SIS), code-named the Circus, is striving to keep pace with other countries' espionage efforts and to keep the U.K. secure. The head of the Circus, known as Control (John Hurt), personally sends dedicated operative Jim Prideaux (Mark Strong) into Hungary. But Jim's mission goes bloodily awry, and Control is forced out of the Circus—as is his top lieutenant, George Smiley (Gary Oldman), a career spy with razor-sharp senses. Estranged from his absent wife, Smiley is soon called in to see Undersecretary Oliver Lacon (Simon McBurney), who tells him that he is to be rehired in secret. There is a gnawing fear that the Circus has long been compromised by a double agent working for the Soviets, jeopardizing England. Supported by younger agent Peter Guillam (Benedict Cumberbatch), Smiley pores over Circus activities past and present, trying to find the mole. Also starring Colin Firth, Tom Hardy, Toby Jones, Kathy Burke and Ciarán Hinds. Directed by Tomas Alfredson (Let the Right One In).
item.how_to_find_us: RSVP to get more details and make the arrangements with Andrea and Judi

group.name: Mosaic Jewish Outdoor Club of Massachusetts

item.name: A Movie and Chinese Food for Christmas
